definitions.definition: a room in which meals are cooked or prepared

examples.text: He stabbed her with a **kitchen knife**.
The house has a fully **fitted kitchen** with custom-built units.
I sat at the kitchen island eating a bowl of cereal.
We handed our trays through the kitchen hatch as we left.

definitions.definition: a very large number of things, probably more than is necessary

examples.text: We seem to take everything but the kitchen sink when we go camping.

definitions.definition: used to tell somebody to stop trying to do something if they find it too difficult, especially in order to suggest that they are less able than other people

wordOrigin: Old English cycene, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch keuken and German Küche, based on Latin coquere ‘to cook’.
